story:
Once upon a time, in a small village nestled in the hills of Israel, there lived a kind and gentle Jewish father named Moshe. Moshe had a beautiful daughter named Simcha, which means "joy" in Hebrew. Simcha was a curious and adventurous girl, always eager to learn and explore the world around her.

One day, Simcha came to her father with a question. "Abba," she said, "why do we Jews celebrate Shabbat every week?"

Moshe smiled at his daughter and took her hand. "Well, my dear Simcha," he said, "Shabbat is a special day set aside for us to rest and recharge our bodies and souls. It is a day to remember all the good things that the Lord has given us and to show our gratitude by spending time with our loved ones and enjoying the beauty of the world around us."

Simcha listened carefully to her father's words and asked, "But Abba, how do we make Shabbat special and different from the other days of the week?"

Moshe thought for a moment and then said, "My dear Simcha, we make Shabbat special by preparing for it with joy and anticipation. We clean our homes, cook delicious meals, and set the table with our finest dishes. We also light candles to welcome the Sabbath and say special prayers to thank the Lord for all His blessings."

Simcha's face lit up with excitement. "Abba, can we make Shabbat special together this week?" she asked.

Moshe nodded and smiled. "Of course, my dear Simcha. I would be delighted to make Shabbat special with you."

And so, father and daughter worked together to prepare for Shabbat. They cleaned the house, cooked a delicious meal, and set the table with their finest dishes. When the sun began to set, they lit the candles and said the special prayers together.

As they sat down to enjoy their Shabbat meal, Simcha looked around the table and felt a warm feeling in her heart. She realized that the love and joy they had put into preparing for Shabbat had made the day truly special and different from any other.

And so, Simcha learned the importance of making every day special, no matter how small or simple, by filling it with love, joy, and gratitude.

From that day on, Simcha and Moshe continued to celebrate Shabbat together every week, and their bond grew stronger and deeper with each passing day.

And they all lived happily ever after. The end.

Goodnight, my dear daughter. May you always find joy and blessings in every day and in every moment.
